docs.snippet: Ted Cruz kicked off his re-election bid this week. His opponent, Beto O’Rourke, has raised more money than any Democrat running for Senate in Texas ever has.

headline.main: In Texas, Ted Cruz Is Facing an Unusual Challenge: A Formidably Financed Democrat
headline.print_headline: For First Time, Cruz Faces  A Well-Funded Democrat

docs.snippet: U.S. stocks dropped about 2 percent on Friday, with the Dow falling more than 570 points, as U.S. President Donald Trump's latest tariff threat on Chinese imports fueled increasing concern over a U.S. trade war with China.

headline.main: Wall Street Ends Down 2 Percent as U.S.-China Trade Fears Intensify
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Ends Down 2 Percent as U.S.-China Trade Fears Intensify

docs.snippet: Former Minnesota Gov. Tim Pawlenty announced Thursday he will run for his old job, ending months of speculation about a return to politics following his short-lived 2012 presidential campaign.

headline.main: Minnesota's Pawlenty Seeks Return to Governor's Mansion
headline.print_headline: Minnesota's Pawlenty Seeks Return to Governor's Mansion

docs.snippet: The United States and China, the world's two largest economies, have roiled financial markets and fueled fears of a protracted trade war by threatening tariffs this week on each other's goods.

headline.main: AP News Guide: What's Behind the US-China Trade Fight
headline.print_headline: AP News Guide: What's Behind the US-China Trade Fight

docs.snippet: China's threat to raise tariffs on U.S. exports could be a disaster for American soybean farmers but a boon to their Brazilian and Argentine competitors, European aerospace companies and Japanese whiskey distillers.

headline.main: China-US Tariff Spat: Mostly Losers, but Some Winners Too
headline.print_headline: China-US Tariff Spat: Mostly Losers, but Some Winners Too

docs.snippet: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Friday painted a mostly sunny view of the U.S. economy and said the Fed remains committed to raising its key interest rate gradually unless events change. He said it was too soon to determine how a trade f...

headline.main: Powell Says Fed Expects to Stick With Gradual Rate Hikes
headline.print_headline: Powell Says Fed Expects to Stick With Gradual Rate Hikes
